snippet: A bus carrying Israeli tourists exploded in a fireball outside an airport in Bulgaria, and an aide to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said Iran was behind the attack.
abstract: Tour bus carrying Israeli vacationers explodes outside an airport in Burgas, Bulgaria, killing at least six people and wounding dozens more, in what Bulgaria, Israel and the United States call a terrorist bomb attack; Israel quickly blames Iran and promises a firm response.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and MATTHEW BRUNWASSER
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Berlin, and Matthew Brunwasser from Istanbul. Reporting was contributed by Jodi Rudoren, Gabby Sobelman and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: A bus carrying Israeli tourists exploded in a fireball outside an airport in Bulgaria, and an aide to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said Iran was behind the attack.

headline.seo: Explosion on Bulgaria Tour Bus Kills at Least Five Israelis
headline.main: 5 Israelis Killed in Bulgaria; Netanyahu Blames Iranians
headline.print_headline: Bus Bomb Kills 6 in Bulgaria; Israel Blames Iran for the Blast
